Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Close top ad Marauder (Legacy of the Void) ============================= From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see [Marauder (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Marauder_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Marauder (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") and [Marauder (Wings of Liberty Campaign)](/starcraft2/Marauder_(Wings_of_Liberty_Campaign) "Marauder (Wings of Liberty Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Terran](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/1/1e/Terran_race_icon.png/30px-Terran_race_icon.png%20%22Terran%22) Marauder [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/3/30/SC2Marauder.jpg/600px-SC2Marauder.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Marauder.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/3/30/SC2Marauder.jpg/600px-SC2Marauder.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Marauder.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: Heavy assault infantry. Built From: [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") with [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  25 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/0b/Buildtime_terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  21 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/b/ba/Supply-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  2 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : D Attack 1: Punisher Grenades Targets: Ground Damage: 10 (+1) * Slows targeted units ([Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") ) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 9.3 (+0.93) 14.1 (+1.4) ([Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") ) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 1.07 (-0.36) Bonus: +10 (+1) vs [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") Bonus DPS: +9.3 (+0.93) vs [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") +14.1 (+1.4) ([Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") ) [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 6 Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 125 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 1 (+1) Attributes: [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Biological](/starcraft2/Biological "Biological") Sight: 10 Speed: 3.15 (+1.57) Cargo size: 2 Strong against: * [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") * [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") * [Thor](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") Weak against: * [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") * [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") * [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Notes](#Notes) * [3 Abilities](#Abilities) * [4 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [5 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [5.1 General](#General) * [5.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [5.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [5.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Produced from a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") with a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Barracks "Tech Lab") , most of this unit's attention will be against other armored units such as the [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") or the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") . Being almost the opposite of a [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") this unit is meaty and slow firing, and will take some attention during battles to make this unit target [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") units to do full damage. Supplementing this is the Marauder's long range and heavy damage every individual shot. Their health and armor make them somewhat better of a meatshield than Marines as well. Marauder's [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") ability trap enemy units and stop priority targets from retreating without taking more damage, which works well with [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") 's effect. Marauders are effective at the front of an engagement to take damage for [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") and then be healed by [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") ; known collectively as MMM or Terran Bio (Barracks). It is not a massing unit like the Marine and [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , because it has a slight delay on its projectile attack (like the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") it counters) that takes a while to hit the opposing unit and can miss: usually from the opponent unit dying, [Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") /[Burrowing](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Burrowing&action=edit&redlink=1 "Burrowing (page does not exist)") , etc. can dodge hits or overkill targets. Notes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Notes")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * Marauders have a range of 6 and stand behind [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") when issued attack-move command. * Control+Click a Marauder and all nearby will be selected. * Use this to micro Marauders forward when needed to tank against, for example, [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") . * Marauder projectiles have a blue trail after Concussive Shells upgrade is applied. * The [Raven](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") 's [Point Defense Drone](/starcraft2/Point_Defense_Drone "Point Defense Drone") ability, removed in the 4.0.0 patch, was able to shut down Marauder projectiles. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Marauders can be upgraded with [Stimpacks](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") and [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") from a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") connected to a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") . [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/3/39/Stimpack.png/62px-Stimpack.png)](/starcraft2/File:Stimpack.png) | **[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 11 s

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** T

Increases the movement speed and firing rate by 50% at the cost of 10 HP for a [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine")
or 20 HP for a [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder")

:** 1.07 s

Slows an enemy's movement speed by 50% when hit by the [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder")
's attack. The slowing effect does not stack, but the timer is refreshed by subsequent hits. [Massive](/starcraft2/Massive "Massive")
units are immune to the slow. | Upgrades\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Upgrades")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- These upgrades are researched at the Barracks' [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") . gain the **Concussive Shells** ability. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: General")\ \] With the [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") upgrade, Marauders can kite many non-massive units with ease. This makes them highly effective against early- and mid-game compositions from any of the three races, and allows them to retreat fairly easily, as no concussed unit is faster than a Marauder with Stimpack. Combined with their bonus against Armored units and considerable health, they are generally the heavy lifters of a Terran biological army. With their high health and better armor they can be sent to the front of a Bio army to tank melee units, although they are not effective damage-wise against what are light and mobile assailants. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] The Marauder is one of the key components of a Bio-heavy unit composition. The Marauder's extra damage against Armored units is particularly effective against [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") . Additionally, Marauder [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") will prevent a retreating Protoss army from getting too far, then allowing the Terran player to hunt them down if they have enough forces to do so. Approaching [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") without [Charge](/starcraft2/Charge "Charge") can be kited with the additional help of [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") . Without the armor damage bonus, they deal rather less damage to Zealots however, and pure Marauder blobs can be defeated by Zealots with [Charge](/starcraft2/Charge "Charge") , necessitating the more versatile Marine. Powerful support options in the later game such as the [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") ' [Psionic Storms](/starcraft2/Psionic_Storm "Psionic Storm") or Colossi with [Extended Thermal Lances](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lances "Extended Thermal Lances") that complement Zealots rip through them as well, although they tend to fare somewhat better than Marines. Marauders tend to still be useful in the late-game however when the focus of Terran production is to deal with a Colossi and Stalker ball, where Marauders can be clean-up duty with [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") hunting Colossi. Marauders can be even more effective when their attack bonus is combined with the benefits of a [Ghost](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") 's [EMP](/starcraft2/EMP "EMP") to take down heavy units like the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") , demanding less additional Marines. However, despite the Marauders being able to kite and deal great damage against [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") , once they begin to clump up, it's getting more and more difficult to dodge [Purification Novas](/starcraft2/Purification_Nova "Purification Nova") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Commonly seen in Bio vs. Mech or Bio-Mech vs. Mech games, Marauders are typically mixed in with [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") for the following reasons: * Marauders do +10 damage against [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") units, which is helpful against Mech compositions whose primary damage dealer is the [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") . * Since Marauders do more damage per attack than Marines but fire at a slower rate, they can be [stutter stepped](/starcraft2/Stutter_Step "Stutter Step") more efficiently than Marines as they can cover more distance between each attack while still maintaining full DPS. Coupled with their slightly longer range, this allows Marauders to be more mobile than Marines when micromanaged against Siege Tanks in a direct engagement. * Although Siege Tanks deal bonus damage to Armored units like the Marauder, Marauders have larger unit models than Marines, reducing the effectiveness of Siege Tanks' splash damage as they will hit less units with each attack. * Marauder's slowing effect from [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") is effective against [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion "Hellion") and prevents Siege Tanks from retreating. * Since they have the Armored instead of [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") [Attribute](/starcraft2/Attributes "Attributes") , they do not take bonus damage from Hellions or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") , unlike Marines. In Bio-Mech vs. Bio-Mech games, Marauders are often times forgone entirely, as they are both resource inefficient and supply inefficient against Marines in large battles. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Due to its bonus damage against Armored enemies, the Marauder is very effective against [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") based armies, especially when paired with [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") . Against the common [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") \-[Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") \-[Mutalisk](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") composition, adding Marauders into the Terran army forces the Zerg player to target-fire the Marines with the Banelings rather than simply attack-moving them (else they will inefficiently detonate on Marauders). This also allows the Terran player to more easily split Marines against the Banelings, as the Zerg player will have to manually target different groups of Marines with the Banelings rather than allowing the A.I. to do it automatically via an attack-move command. Marauders are weak against Zerglings, so it is important to keep them supported by Marines and/or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") to prevent them from being quickly surrounded and killed. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Produced from a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") with a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Barracks "Tech Lab") , most of this unit's attention will be against other armored units such as the [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") or the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") . Being almost the opposite of a [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") this unit is meaty and slow firing, and will take some attention during battles to make this unit target [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") units to do full damage. Supplementing this is the Marauder's long range and heavy damage every individual shot. Their health and armor make them somewhat better of a meatshield than Marines as well. Marauder's [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") ability trap enemy units and stop priority targets from retreating without taking more damage, which works well with [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") 's effect. Marauders are effective at the front of an engagement to take damage for [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") and then be healed by [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") ; known collectively as MMM or Terran Bio (Barracks). It is not a massing unit like the Marine and [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") , because it has a slight delay on its projectile attack (like the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") it counters) that takes a while to hit the opposing unit and can miss: usually from the opponent unit dying, [Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") /[Burrowing](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Burrowing&action=edit&redlink=1 "Burrowing (page does not exist)") , etc. can dodge hits or overkill targets. Notes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Notes")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * Marauders have a range of 6 and stand behind [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") when issued attack-move command. * Control+Click a Marauder and all nearby will be selected. * Use this to micro Marauders forward when needed to tank against, for example, [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") . * Marauder projectiles have a blue trail after Concussive Shells upgrade is applied. * The [Raven](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") 's [Point Defense Drone](/starcraft2/Point_Defense_Drone "Point Defense Drone") ability, removed in the 4.0.0 patch, was able to shut down Marauder projectiles. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Marauders can be upgraded with [Stimpacks](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") and [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") from a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") connected to a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") . This makes them highly effective against early- and mid-game compositions from any of the three races, and allows them to retreat fairly easily, as no concussed unit is faster than a Marauder with Stimpack. Combined with their bonus against Armored units and considerable health, they are generally the heavy lifters of a Terran biological army. With their high health and better armor they can be sent to the front of a Bio army to tank melee units, although they are not effective damage-wise against what are light and mobile assailants. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] The Marauder is one of the key components of a Bio-heavy unit composition. The Marauder's extra damage against Armored units is particularly effective against [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") . Additionally, Marauder [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") will prevent a retreating Protoss army from getting too far, then allowing the Terran player to hunt them down if they have enough forces to do so. Approaching [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") without [Charge](/starcraft2/Charge "Charge") can be kited with the additional help of [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") . Without the armor damage bonus, they deal rather less damage to Zealots however, and pure Marauder blobs can be defeated by Zealots with [Charge](/starcraft2/Charge "Charge") , necessitating the more versatile Marine. Powerful support options in the later game such as the [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templar "High Templar") ' [Psionic Storms](/starcraft2/Psionic_Storm "Psionic Storm") or Colossi with [Extended Thermal Lances](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lances "Extended Thermal Lances") that complement Zealots rip through them as well, although they tend to fare somewhat better than Marines. Marauders tend to still be useful in the late-game however when the focus of Terran production is to deal with a Colossi and Stalker ball, where Marauders can be clean-up duty with [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") hunting Colossi. Marauders can be even more effective when their attack bonus is combined with the benefits of a [Ghost](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") 's [EMP](/starcraft2/EMP "EMP") to take down heavy units like the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") , demanding less additional Marines. However, despite the Marauders being able to kite and deal great damage against [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") , once they begin to clump up, it's getting more and more difficult to dodge [Purification Novas](/starcraft2/Purification_Nova "Purification Nova") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Commonly seen in Bio vs. Mech or Bio-Mech vs. Mech games, Marauders are typically mixed in with [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") for the following reasons: * Marauders do +10 damage against [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") units, which is helpful against Mech compositions whose primary damage dealer is the [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") . * Since Marauders do more damage per attack than Marines but fire at a slower rate, they can be [stutter stepped](/starcraft2/Stutter_Step "Stutter Step") more efficiently than Marines as they can cover more distance between each attack while still maintaining full DPS. Coupled with their slightly longer range, this allows Marauders to be more mobile than Marines when micromanaged against Siege Tanks in a direct engagement. * Although Siege Tanks deal bonus damage to Armored units like the Marauder, Marauders have larger unit models than Marines, reducing the effectiveness of Siege Tanks' splash damage as they will hit less units with each attack. * Marauder's slowing effect from [Concussive Shells](/starcraft2/Concussive_Shells "Concussive Shells") is effective against [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion "Hellion") and prevents Siege Tanks from retreating. * Since they have the Armored instead of [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") [Attribute](/starcraft2/Attributes "Attributes") , they do not take bonus damage from Hellions or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") , unlike Marines. In Bio-Mech vs. Bio-Mech games, Marauders are often times forgone entirely, as they are both resource inefficient and supply inefficient against Marines in large battles. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marauder_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Due to its bonus damage against Armored enemies, the Marauder is very effective against [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") based armies, especially when paired with [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") . Against the common [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") \-[Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") \-[Mutalisk](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") composition, adding Marauders into the Terran army forces the Zerg player to target-fire the Marines with the Banelings rather than simply attack-moving them (else they will inefficiently detonate on Marauders). This also allows the Terran player to more easily split Marines against the Banelings, as the Zerg player will have to manually target different groups of Marines with the Banelings rather than allowing the A.I. to do it automatically via an attack-move command. Marauders are weak against Zerglings, so it is important to keep them supported by Marines and/or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") to prevent them from being quickly surrounded and killed.
